name: Bulb
description: Car bulbs are lights used in vehicles for safety and visibility. There are many different types of car bulbs, including halogen, LED, xenon, and laser.

name: Dashcam
description: A dashcam is a small camera that records your car's surroundings while you drive

name: Mats
description: Car mats are accessories that protect the floor of a vehicle from dirt, noise, and corrosion

name: Seat Cover
description: A car seat cover is a protective material that fits over a vehicle's existing seats.

name: Side Mirror
description: A side mirror, also known as a door mirror or wing mirror, is a mirror on the outside of a car that helps the driver see behind and to the sides of the vehicle.

name: Steering Wheel Cover
description: A steering wheel cover is an accessory you can buy to make driving more comfortable, protect your factory-issued steering wheel, or cover up blemishes, rips, or tears

name: CamShaft
description: A camshaft is a rod with cams that controls the opening and closing of valves in a car engine.

name: Engine Cylinder
description: A car engine cylinder head is the uppermost part of the engine block, acting as a cover that houses critical components like the intake and exhaust valves, spark plugs, and combustion chambers

name: Head Gasket
description: A car's head gasket is a seal that sits between the engine block and the cylinder head

name: Piston
description: A car's piston is a cylindrical metal part that moves up and down in the engine's cylinder

name: Brake Cylinder
description: a key component in the braking system that converts the pressure applied by the brake pedal into hydraulic pressure, pushing brake fluid through lines to the wheels, ultimately causing the brakes to engage and slow down the vehicle

name: Brake Disc
description: The brake rotor (disc) which rotates with the wheel, is clamped by brake pads (friction material) fitted to the caliper from both sides with pressure from the piston(s) (pressure mechanism) and decelerates the disc rotation, thereby slowing down and stopping the vehicle.

name: Brake Hose
description: A brake hose is a flexible tube that carries brake fluid from the brake line to the brake caliper.

name: Brake Pad
description: A brake pad in a car is a friction component within the braking system that, when pressed against a rotating brake disc by the caliper, creates friction to slow down or stop the wheel, effectively allowing the car to decelerate when the brake pedal is pressed

name: Control Arm
description: A control arm, also known as an A-arm or wishbone, is a hinged link between a car's chassis and the wheel assembly

name: Steering Rack
description: A car's steering rack is a crucial component of the steering system that converts the rotational motion of the steering wheel into linear motion,

name: Steering Tie Rod
description: A steering tie rod is a metal rod that connects the steering gear to the steering knuckle on a car's front wheels.

name: Hub Bearing
description: A car's wheel hub bearing is a vital part of the wheel assembly that allows the wheels to turn smoothly.

name: Alloy
description: Alloy wheels are car wheels made from a combination of metals, such as aluminum or magnesium, that are lighter and stronger than steel wheels.

name: Aluminum
description: Aluminum wheels are lightweight, strong, and attractive alloy wheels that are often used on cars.

name: Chrome
description: Chrome on cars is a decorative, shiny coating that protects metal parts from corrosion and rust.

name: Steel
description: Steel wheels are car wheels made from steel and are often found on entry-level and older vehicles.
